body:
## Feature
Implement comprehensive debug mode.

### Requirements
- --debug flag for all commands
- Verbose subprocess output
- Git command logging
- API call logging
- Performance metrics

### Output
- Debug log file
- Optional console output
- Structured log format
- Timing information
title: Add debug mode with verbose logging

body:
## Feature
Notify users of available updates.

### Requirements
- Check for updates on startup (optional)
- Compare versions correctly
- Show changelog highlights
- Provide update command
- Respect user preferences

### Implementation
- Use GitHub releases API
- Cache check results
- Add --skip-update-check flag
title: Implement update notification system

body:
## Task
Document version compatibility matrix.

### Contents
- Python versions (3.10, 3.11, 3.12)
- git versions (2.31+)
- gh CLI versions
- macOS versions (12+)
- Agent version requirements

### Testing
- Test on multiple versions
- Document known issues
- Update CI matrix
title: Create compatibility matrix documentation

body:
## Feature

### Filters
- Labels (include/exclude)
- Assignee
- Milestone
- Date range
- Text search

### Implementation
- Extend gh issue list command
- Cache filtered results
- Remember last filter
title: Add issue filtering capabilities

body:
## Feature
Side-by-side diff view between agent solutions.

### Requirements
- Compare any two agents' changes
- Syntax highlighting
- Conflict detection
- Stats summary
- Navigate between files

### UI Design
- Split view in base panel
- Keyboard shortcuts for navigation
- Export diff to file
title: Implement agent diff comparison view

body:
## Feature
Add --dry-run flag to preview operations without execution.

### Requirements
- Show what would be cloned/created
- Display worktree operations
- Preview PR that would be created
- No actual git operations
- Clear indication of dry run mode

### Implementation
- Add flag to all commands
- Mock git operations in dry run
- Format output clearly
title: Implement dry run mode

body:
## Task
Create comprehensive development setup guide.

### Contents
- Prerequisites installation
- Virtual environment setup
- IDE configuration (VSCode, PyCharm)
- Pre-commit hooks setup
- Running tests locally
- Debugging the TUI

### Deliverables
- docs/development-setup.md
- .vscode/settings.json
- .editorconfig
- Makefile for common tasks
title: Create development setup guide

body:
## Decision Required
Define performance targets and limits.

### Areas to Define

1. **Concurrent Agents**
   - Maximum number: 5? 10? Unlimited?
   - Resource allocation strategy

2. **Log Handling**
   - Buffer size per agent
   - Streaming chunk size
   - Retention policy

3. **Repository Size**
   - Maximum repo size
   - Worktree strategy for large repos
   - Shallow clone support

4. **Timeout Values**
   - Agent execution timeout
   - Ready marker check interval
   - Network operation timeouts

### Proposed Limits
- Max 5 concurrent agents (MVP)
- 10MB log buffer per agent
- 1GB max repo size (warning)
- 30 min agent timeout

### Decision
TBD
title: [ADR-005] Performance & Scalability Targets

body:
## Decision Required
Define security model for agent execution.

### Considerations

1. **File System Access**
   - Full access to worktree only
   - Read-only access to parent repo
   - No access outside project

2. **Network Access**
   - Unrestricted (current plan)
   - Allowlist of domains
   - Proxy all requests

3. **Process Limits**
   - CPU limits
   - Memory limits
   - Time limits

4. **Secret Handling**
   - Environment variable passthrough
   - Secret redaction in logs
   - Credential storage

### Proposed Model
- Agents run with user privileges (MVP)
- Secrets from environment only
- Basic redaction in logs
- No sandboxing in MVP

### Decision
TBD
title: [ADR-004] Security Model & Sandboxing

body:
## Decision Required
Define the exact protocol for agent communication.

### Areas to Define

1. **Command Line Arguments**
   - Standardized flags vs environment variables only
   - JSON config file vs individual args

2. **Output Format**
   - Plain text with markers
   - Structured JSON lines
   - Custom protocol

3. **Ready Signal**
   - Git commit message marker (current plan)
   - File marker
   - Exit code

4. **Error Reporting**
   - Exit codes
   - Stderr format
   - Error file

### Proposed Protocol
```bash
agent --repo-path /path --issue-number 123 --issue-url https://... --issue-body-file /tmp/issue.txt
```

Output: JSON lines to stdout
```json
{"level": "info", "message": "Starting analysis", "timestamp": "2024-01-01T00:00:00Z"}
```

### Decision
TBD
title: [ADR-003] Define Agent Communication Protocol

body:
## Decision Required
Choose between Click and Typer for CLI implementation.

### Options

#### Option 1: Click
- **Pros**: Battle-tested, extensive features, large ecosystem
- **Cons**: More verbose, older patterns

#### Option 2: Typer
- **Pros**: Modern, type hints, auto-completion, built on Click
- **Cons**: Smaller community, fewer examples

### Criteria
- Type safety
- Auto-completion support
- Documentation generation
- Testing support

### Decision
[ ] Click
[ ] Typer
title: [ADR-002] Choose CLI Framework

body:
## Decision Required
Choose between Textual and Rich for the TUI implementation.

### Options

#### Option 1: Textual
- **Pros**: Full-featured, reactive, CSS styling, better testing support
- **Cons**: Heavier dependency, steeper learning curve
- **Size**: ~2MB

#### Option 2: Rich
- **Pros**: Lightweight, simpler API, good enough for basic TUI
- **Cons**: Less features, manual event loop management
- **Size**: ~500KB

### Criteria
- Performance with streaming logs
- Testing capabilities
- Documentation quality
- Community support

### Recommendation
TBD after prototype evaluation

### Decision
[ ] Textual
[ ] Rich
title: [ADR-001] Choose TUI Framework
